parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Perhaps remotely derived from the base of basis; to lift, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Probably from the same as basis; weight; in the New Testament only, figuratively, a load, abundance, authority.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From ana and pleroo; to complete; by implication, to occupy, supply; figuratively, to accomplish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
